revised_title: Observations of Solar Phenomena and a Proposal for Solar Spot Mapping
tldr: In a letter to Dr. Bache, Charles Babbage discusses his observations of pink excrescences on the sun's disk during a solar eclipse and proposes two methods to study these phenomena: using an opaque disk in an equatorial telescope or taking daguerreotype images. He encourages others to try these methods and record the solar spots and their changes.
